sections.title: Crimson Templar (Class Overview)
sections.description: Overview of the Crimson Templar class including role, alignment, hit die, and starting wealth.

sections.title: Fiendish Studies (Ex) (Crimson Templar)
sections.description: Allows the crimson templar to study evil outsiders as a move action, granting bonuses to skill checks, attack rolls, damage rolls, and class ability DCs against the studied target. Can be triggered as an immediate action when dealing sneak attack damage.

sections.title: Obedience (Crimson Templar)
sections.description: Grants Deific Obedience as a bonus feat at 1st level, or a bonus combat feat if the crimson templar already has Deific Obedience or Celestial Obedience.

sections.title: Shield of Wings (Su) (Crimson Templar)
sections.description: Provides escalating fire resistance that becomes fire immunity at 9th level, and allows manifesting burning wings for flight as a swift action. Fire protection is lost while wings are active and for an equal duration afterward.

sections.title: Ruthlessness (Ex) (Crimson Templar)
sections.description: Allows the crimson templar to perform a coup de grace with a bastard sword as a standard action instead of a full-round action.

sections.title: Sneak Attack (Ex) (Crimson Templar)
sections.description: Functions like the rogue's sneak attack ability, starting at 1d6 at 2nd level and increasing by 1d6 every 3 levels thereafter. Stacks with sneak attack from other sources.

sections.title: Bonus Feat (Crimson Templar)
sections.description: Grants bonus combat feats at 3rd, 6th, and 9th levels, with normal prerequisite requirements still applying.

sections.title: Divine Boon (Crimson Templar)
sections.description: Grants access to the associated deity's boons at 4th, 7th, and 10th levels, allowing earlier access than normal obedience feats provide.

sections.title: Heavenly Fire (Su) (Crimson Templar)
sections.description: Deals additional divine fire damage when delivering sneak attacks to creatures affected by fiendish studies, requiring a Fortitude save to avoid extra damage that is half fire and half divine energy.

sections.title: Immolate (Su) (Crimson Templar)
sections.description: Causes evil creatures reduced to negative hit points by sneak attacks or coup de grace to potentially disintegrate entirely, with no save if reduced by heavenly fire.
